sub_title: Senior Researcher at Netherlands Interdisciplinary Demographic Institute/Royal Academy of Arts and Sciences
summary:
I carry out social science research covering themes such as migration and acculturation, public health, gender issues, population scenarios. At times I give lectures on demographic analysis methods and on my research-related topics.

In the past, I worked as a consultant to design, implement, monitor and evaluate social science surveys in different settings (e.g. American Samoa, Armenia, Bangladesh, Ethiopia, India, Malaysia, Philippines, Senegal, Tanzania). Upon request, I designed and delivered tailored training courses in Analytical Demography (including Population Projections) for government staff in several countries (e.g. Botswana, Eritrea, Egypt, Suriname (Dutch Guyana)). 

I try applying lateral thinking to resolve research and personal-life questions (E. de Bono,1969).
